page.title: 01General review of block
page.content: This area divides into two sections. Most of it consists of the upper valley of the Otter, where the hills begin to close in round the river as you approach its source,which lies a mile or two to the north.The smaller eastern section is part of the flat Blackdown tableland,about 200 metres above sea-level and stretching fingerlike southwards between the Otter and Yarty valleys. The valley area is well watered by many small streams and rills:and after a heavy fall of rain the air is full of the sound of gurgling water. The land is only suitable for grazing, but this is carried on intensively, and the landscape is a patchwork of green fields,copses,isolated farmsteads and winding lanes between hedges.
